pinyin: chī bǎo le fàn chēng de

etymology.description: 吃饱了饭 + 撑的 = overstuffed and idle ⇒ doing pointless things.
etymology.interpretation: Colloquial scold implying someone is so well‑fed and idle that they fuss over meaningless things. 撑 highlights being stuffed to discomfort, extended to boredom-induced meddling.
etymology.simplification: 飽→饱 and 飯→饭 use the simplified food radical 饣; 撐→撑 replaces a complex phonetic with 争 for fewer strokes. The phrase’s meaning is unchanged; only characters were streamlined.

parts.english: after eating one’s fill; be full from a meal; having just eaten
so stuffed (from eating); overfull; propped/held up; (de: structural particle forming an adjectival phrase)

examples.chinese: 你这么折腾(你這麼折騰)，简直是吃饱了饭撑的(簡直是吃飽了飯撐的)。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ zhème zhēteng, jiǎnzhí shì chī bǎo le fàn chēng de.
examples.english: You’re fussing around—this is exactly what people do when they’re too full and idle.

examples.chinese: 闲得无聊才去挑别人的毛病(閒得無聊才去挑別人的毛病)，真是吃饱了饭撑的(真是吃飽了飯撐的)。
examples.pinyin: Xián de wúliáo cái qù tiāo biérén de máobìng, zhēn shì chī bǎo le fàn chēng de.
examples.english: Only someone bored out of their mind would nitpick others—clearly has nothing better to do.

examples.chinese: 他一天到晚发无意义的帖子(他一天到晚發無意義的帖子)，看来是吃饱了饭撑的(看來是吃飽了飯撐的)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yītiān dào wǎn fā wú yìyì de tiězi, kànlái shì chī bǎo le fàn chēng de.
examples.english: He posts pointless stuff all day long—looks like he’s just bored and killing time.
